resources.string: AIIMS Bhopal is one of the seven AIIMS apex healthcare institutes being established by the Ministry of Health & Family Welfare, Government of India under the Pradhan Mantri Swasthya Suraksha Yojna(PMSSY). With the aim of correcting regional imbalances in quality tertiary level healthcare in the country, and attaining self sufficiency in graduate and postgraduate medical education and training the PMSSY planned to set up 6 new AIIMS like institutions in under served areas of the country.

These institutions are being established by an Act of Parliament on the lines of the original All India Institute of Medical Sciences in New Delhi which imparts both undergraduate and postgraduate medical education in all its branches and related fields, along with nursing and paramedical training. to bring together in one place educational facilities of the highest order for the training of personnel in all branches of health care activity.
The list below summarizes all the detials of the doctors who provide services at AIIMS,Bhopal. Please refer, and post any complaints if any name is missing on the list. Thank you!
->New OPD Card costing Rs. 10/- and shall be valid for 10 days. It can be recharged every 10 days. The follow up visits within up to 10 days is free
-> All Clinics function between 9 am and 1 pm. Registration for new patients is between 8:30 am and 11:30 am
->Patients are seen on first come first serve basis. However, out of turn consultation may be provided in case of emergency or to senior citizens.
->You have right to consult any doctor/ consultant. For seeking appointment with any consultant on his OPD days, you may contact his/her office
->For consultation in Specialty and Super-specialty clinics, you need to have referred from general OPD of AIIMS Bhopal or any Government Institution
->Sample Collection Timings are:- 8:00 AM to 1:30 AM
->Only USG facilities are available on upper ground floor at present. The expansion of services are underway and shall be started shortly.

->Certain investigations are done free of charge while others are charged as per the prevailing norms fixed by Government. Patients should Deposit the money only at the designated hospital Cash Counters and obtain the proper receipt
->The report normally reaches the concerned OPD on the next OPD day
->Certain specialized investigations are done on particular days only
